alert.note: Alert for Butler; Hamilton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 6:42PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHEASTERN RIPLEY, NORTHERN DEARBORN, NORTHWESTERN HAMILTON AND SOUTHWESTERN BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 642 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 7 miles south of Brookville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Harrison, Brookville, Bright, Hidden Valley, Ross, Cleves, Shawnee, Taylor Creek, Miami Heights, Blue Jay, Mack, Dunlap, Dry Ridge, Logan, New Haven, Grandview, Sunman, Addyston and North Bend. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
